Package oy.tol.tra

Interface StackInterface<E>

All Known Implementing Classes:
StackImplementation
public interface StackInterface<E>
An interface to stack class holding elements of type E.

  • Method Details

    • init

      void init(Class<E> elementClass, int size) throws StackAllocationException
      Initializes the stack with a count of elements it can hold initially.

      You must implement an internal data storage for the elements, an array of elements E. Initialize the stack like this (for holding Integers): stack.init(Integer.class, size);

      Parameters:
      elementClass - The type of things to store in the stack.
      size - The number of elements the stack data structure can initially hold. MUST be > 1.
      Throws:
      StackAllocationException - if stack could not be allocated.

    • capacity

      int capacity()
      For querying the capacity of the stack.
      Returns:
      The number of elements the stack can currently hold.

    • push

      void push(E element) throws StackAllocationException, NullPointerException
      Push an element to the stack.

      If the internal array does not have enough room for the element, the implementation MUST first reallocate an array, copy the elements from the old array and then replace the old array with the new array. The capacity of the array must be updated too.

      Parameters:
      element - The element to push, must not be null.
      Throws:
      StackAllocationException - if no additional room can be allocated for the stack
      NullPointerException - if the element pushed is null.

    • pop

      E pop() throws StackIsEmptyException
      Pops an element out of the stack, removing it from the internal data storage.
      Returns:
      The popped element.
      Throws:
      StackIsEmptyException - if the stack is empty.

    • peek

      E peek() throws StackIsEmptyException
      Returns the element at the top of the stack, not removing it from the stack.
      Returns:
      The element.
      Throws:
      StackIsEmptyException - if the stack is empty.

    • count

      int count()
      Returns the count of elements currently in the stack.
      Returns:
      Count of elements in the stack.

    • empty

      boolean empty()
      Use to check if the stack is empty.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the stack is empty, false otherwise.

    • reset

      void reset()
      Resets the stack. State of the stack should be as if it was just created and empty.

    • reallocate

      void reallocate(int n)
      Reallocates the stack. Doubles the capacity of the original stack.
